Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful”
Reviews.Author: CCP1967
Reviews.Content: This is a fascinating hotel with real charm. It is in a wonderful and vibrant area of the city, with so many fantastic bard and restaurants. But the hotel is the main attraction. It is small, and interesting. The rooms are absolutely beautiful, we have stayed here three times and each time we look forward to seeing which of their wonderful rooms we have. The price is very reasonable for Paris, and it simply would not occur to me to stay anywhere else in Paris. I recommend the hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: TommyMc
Reviews.Content: Small but perfectly formed hotel, good sized rooms and bathrooms (for Paris) and immaculately decorated. The hotel is in a wonderful position down a pretty Parisian side street within easy walking distance of good restaurants and bars. Paris metro is walkable, Gare du Nord and the river are not far either (15 min walk). We travelled to see a band (The Shins) in the nearby La Bataclan which was a five minute walk away but would stay here again irrespective of the reason for the visit. If you have stayed in Paris before and overpaid for an average hotel, do yourself a huge favour and stay here next time it will not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Noalita
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. The room was so interesting and beautiful and just how I pictured a fabulous Parisian hotel to look. It's on a tiny street, tucked away in the "haut" Marais area, which is a very cool area and full of great food and shops. The great news is, that while it's tucked away, you can literally walk everywhere from this hotel. And if not, the metro is just a few blocks away. In addition to a beautiful room and great location, the front desk was very helpful in securing dinner reservations and showing us around the area. And the toiletries were Hermes, which is always appreciated. I also thought that for such a luxurious hotel, 190 euro a night was surprisingly reasonable. We did not try the breakfast but that's because the blackout shades worked too well. Highly recommend this place!!

Reviews.Title: “Fashionable, but...”
Reviews.Author: andermanny
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay. The hotel is wonderfully located in the Marais, and the rooms are a hoot, but very dark. The staff is efficient and courteous, the breakfast very good. Perfect for a fashionista or hipster, maybe not so great for someone who wants a more traditional hotel. Only trouble I had was the air conditioning...it went from very cold to very hot and nothing in between...the staff was very apologetic and presumably this problem is being fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Another hidden gem of Paris”
Reviews.Author: 8DolceBaby8
Reviews.Content: My love for Christian Lacroix designed boutique hotels started roughly around two years ago when I went to Paris for the first time. Hotel du Petit Moulin discretely lies in the heart of the 6th arrondissement (aka the trendsetting Marais), once a boulangerie in a 17th-century building¸ this boutique hotel was transformed by the extraordinarily creative haute-couture designer in Spring, 2005. I had to book the room that I wanted to stay in six months in advance, as I was worried about missing out on one of seventeen uniquely designed rooms in this hotel. Think bold colours, claw-foot bathtubs, Venetian mirrors and fancy wallpaper. The hotel felt intimate and the service was personal. The area in which the hotel is situated is also full of quirky boutiques, cafes and art galleries. Lose yourself exploring rue Charlot, rue de Poitou and rue de Bretagne… For photos of the hotel, please visit my blog: http://dolcebunnie.blogspot.com.au/2012/03/hotel-du-petit-moulin-29-31-rue-du.html

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: klonarts
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a beautiful boutique Parisian hotel that doesn't break the bank, look no further than Hotel du Petit Moulin. Each room is individually designed with different themes from the ingenious Christian Lacroix. Hotel staff are friendly, attentive, give excellent suggestions and the breakfast is incredible. I ate 5 croissants on my first morning. Rooms are a good size, very clean, a great design and the hotel is very close to the bicycles and metro. I paid for a standard room and stayed on the top floor. I am returning to Paris in October 2012 and have booked to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Paris best kept secret”
Reviews.Author: Carolina C
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel in January 2012. I had my heart set on the location - Le Marais - for our trip to Paris in Jan 2012 .... After a lot of research the only options I had were extremely expensive or dated and tired places .... until we found this amazing hotel! The prices are very reasonable for a 4 start hotel in the heart of Paris. The rooms are extremely comfortable and surprisingly big for Paris standards. Bathrooms are big and very well equipped, clean as it can be - and for the girls the toiletries are HERMES - a very cute touch. The decoration of the rooms and hotel areas are amazing with Lacroix wall papers and final touches ... its the first from the many hotels that I have stayed where the actual place is much better than the pictures ... One big plus side is the amazingly helpful and friendly concierge - they went out of their way to help us with bookings, suggested great places to visit and were in general really interested in our deals in Paris - especially Laurence that seems to have every number you can imagine in Paris in his mobile phone and is very in touch with the hot spots in town. The only negative side if so is that the hotel is a small boutique set up with a limited number of rooms and even knowing that the staff will do their best to accommodate you - it gets booked quite fast so plan yourself and book in advance as they have very reasonable cancelation policies anyway. After staying at the Petit Moulin it will be hard to justify another hotel in Paris !

Reviews.Title: “An exquisite boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MilwaukeeWriter
Reviews.Content: Attentive, pleasant service, unique decor, comfortable accommodations. We spent six fabulous nights at this boutique hotel in Marais. Our twenty-year-old son traveled with us, and although we shared a room, we didn't feel cramped, even with the additional cot. I dream of going back to Paris, and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. We loved the area, which was quiet. Highly recommend this hotel if you want a unique experience in a small hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Our Paris favourite!”
Reviews.Author: platinumcitytrip
Reviews.Content: Wonderful design hotel in an old bakery. Great location in 'le marais' with a unbelievably authentic (and delicious) restaurant, chez nenesse, just across the street. Every room is uniquely and surprisingly decorated by lacroix. And for the ladies great shopping just around the corner (also on Sundays). the restaurant rating is for the excellent (continental) breakfast. enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Another Amazing Stay!”
Reviews.Author: paw11
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here now 3 times over the last year and a half, and it's absolutely my favorite hotel in Paris. The rooms are large for a European hotel, the Christian Lacroix decor is perfectly done, and best of all the service is outstanding for a small boutique hotel! I think there are only 15 or so rooms so it never feels that busy, the room service breakfast is a perfect way to start the day, and the neighborhood is the best in the city for shopping and walking. There is a great bakery around the corner - Rose Bakery - that I highly recommend. I also love that Merce & The Muse cafe is only a few blocks away too. The staff are to be commended on consistently providing warm and friendly service!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, friendly and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: TopherTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over New Year in an executive room and I loved this place. I've been trying for a while to get a booking here when in Paris but always left it too late as there are only 17 rooms so it's constantly fully booked. The reception was friendly and helpful and you believed that if you did need anything they would do their best to help. We rang down for a dinner reservation on the first evening and it was sorted with no fuss and an ironing board and iron was available immediately. We were also invited down to the bar for a glass of champagne on New Years Eve. The room was very spacious for a Marais hotel with a large bathroom and dressing area and seating. The toiletries were Hermes and the decor of the rooms was a wonderfully abstract change from your standard hotel room with fabric wallcoverings and stars and planets motif. Only downside was there was no stand up shower in the bathroom which was a little inconvenient and it can be a little noisy if your room looks onto the street, but you can't complain about that if you want to stay in a historical building (it used to be the bakery visited by Victor Hugo) in bustly Marais Overall we had a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT GREAT GREAT GREAT”
Reviews.Author: MariaEdwards
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris for my 40th birthday and I researched everything for, I don't know how long, in advance. I shortlisted a few hotels (It had to be perfect!) and I can say that I was delighted with our choice. From the moment we walked in I knew this was the one, the building is very nice, old and wonderful, our room.... great. Bright pink reception/seating area, black and white bedroom, very, very smart bathroom, standing bath, Hermes toiletries, brilliant!!!!!! We've been to Paris a few times and never been happy with the size of the rooms, tiny spaces, this room was great and the hotel a wonderful discovery. The location is just perfect. So close to so many restaurants and bars, lovely boutiques, nothing is too far, nearest metro is a 2 minute walk. The lady at the reception was SO helpful with places to go and visit, she booked us a restaurant for Saturday night. The whole weekend was a perfect birthday weekend and this hotel was a massive part of it. So Thank you for making my birthday so special. I did feel like a princess in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the Marais”
Reviews.Author: Eva_Maria_10
Reviews.Content: A cosy little hotel with only 17 rooms in the middle of the Marais. From here it is only a few steps to the Rue des Archives and the Rue du Vieille Temple - the Marché des Enfants rouges is just around the corner. My Executive room was spacious (in comparison to other Parisian hotels), the bath room as well, boudoir style, great mix of colourful wallpapers and carpets - typicially fashion designer Christian Lacroix. The entrance of this little gem is an old bakery, where Victor Hugo is said to have bought his bread. The receptionists were extremely friendly and helpful - thanks a million for making my stay a comfortable one. Two little cons: Would not recommend a room next to the elevator, because of the constant noises and putting on make-up in the bathroom is definitely impossible due to the lighting system (shadows in your faces do not allow you to know if you leave the hotel like a clown), but this is a problem that I come across in so many hotels. They all must have been men made ;-) I would for sure stay again at this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic location, in the Marais, humorously "fussy" rooms”
Reviews.Author: LouisaTheK
Reviews.Content: We wanted to be in the Marais, a neighborhood we had reason to explore. And we needed a hotel with an elevator.The location was great. The price impressive. The service was really very nice. Terrific if expensive continental breakfast at $15 euros a pop. All service was lovely except for the one desk who seem annoyed/flustered by our arrival. And replied when we discussed the lack of A/C during a surprisingly balmy Parisian November week, told me that there was no a/c after the summer, and if we didn't like it, we could change to another hotel. But we all softened, and after he thought to get the heat turned off in the room, our second night was much more comfortable. My only real issue was that the rooms are a couturier's fantasy of a hotel room, pretty much like a couturier's dress is a fantasy of anything a woman who reasonably wear out the door. Each room is different but our was on the 3rd floor and I think of it as "the pink" room. Tiny glass retro bed side table with a lamp base too big for you to put even a pair of reading glasses and a glass of water. A black (good sized) bathroom. So chic with its halogen spot lights in the ceiling, in front of the mirror, but almost impossible to see your self in said mirror. And the whole height profile -- a make-up mirror set for someone 5'8 at least. Maybe a lot of the male guests need help putting on their mascara. Lighting is the biggest --totally fixable issue. Also --such a cool Alessi phone I wish I could have figured out how to use it! The room we were in needs reading lights, and something to warm up the nighttime coziness other than sconces on the red damask walls. The fabrics and patterns are truly fun, but a little more attention to what happens when actual people stay in the room for more than one night, not just come for the tour. My comments are all things I think the ownership could easily fix with an update. FOr us, not the right place to stay -- but for a fun, Marais stay for a few nigth, truly wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and elegant hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: cdelucia
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough positive things about this hotel -- it feels like a 5-star hotel with a more unique and comfortable feel compared to some of the more generic top-rated hotels. The rooms are incredibly comfortable and very elegantly designed, and the cleanliness is top-notch. The service is fantastic -- everyone from the hotel we dealt with went out of their way to help us and to make sure we had everything we needed. When you combine the service and the room quality with the location and the value, it's difficult to imagine doing any better in Paris -- I don't think I'll be staying anywhere else other than Hotel du Petit Moulin for subsequent returns to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Eirik2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in one o my favourite areas in Paris, the Marais area. Lot of nice cafes, bars, restaurants and excellent uniqe shops. The Hotel is good value for the money but, the standard might scare people off. Anyway, we loved it and will definetly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: weddinggirlsf
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel with friendly staff. The hotel and room were super clean and the bed was comfortable as if you were at home. The location couldnt have been better and there is a great place for dinner right across the street. We enjoyed our time at this hotel and will for sure be back. We were very pleased with everything. When we left and went to Rome, our hotel there sucked and we wished we were back in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Once again, Hotel du Petit Moulin!”
Reviews.Author: samlupowitz
Reviews.Content: The quality remains as it was: terrific. Warm, friendly personnel too. Beautiful breakfast. Everything. See you again soon, Hotel du Petit Moulin.

Reviews.Title: “A nice quirky hotel”
Reviews.Author: australianlawyer
Reviews.Content: We had a nice room, with good decor (bright pink) - not five star standard, but fine. The staff were friendly. The wi-fi had a strong signal, and was free (perhaps the management have taken account of previous reviews on this website complaining about charges).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with personality on great location”
Reviews.Author: CERAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Paris hotel rooms are tiny. With that in mind we booked an executive room. We had room 403 on the topfloor. It was really spacious, comfortabel and light. Our room was not one of the more 'outrages' ones, which was fines by me 'cause my boyfriend does not necesserily wants to sleep in a purple & pink room... If you do, be sure to state so in your booking. Our bed was great. Some rooms are at streetside. Bring earplugs if you're a light sleeper. The location is wonderful! This nortern part of the Marais is packed with boutiques, cafes, galeries etc, but much less crowded then near the (also wonderful) Place des Vosges. Close to the hotel are 2 Velib' stations, where you can grab a bike and get anywhere in a heartbeat. We absolutely LOVED our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “J'avais adoré et j'y suis retournée”
Reviews.Author: Barbara187870
Reviews.Content: I already gave my opinion on that hotel few years ago. But it is rare that when you go back, everybody remembers you and that the new visit is even better if possible that the previous ones. 17 rooms, all different, all changing over time, everything looks new all the time... Thank you Christian Lacroix for designing this most lovely place - and thanks in particular for the beautiful bar. So small, so nice, so secret... the coffee is delicious, breakfast with fresh fruits, and if you want champagne... mandatory in Paris in August isn't it. And the very best best best in the hotel ? THE PEOPLE at the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic designer hotel in perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Bouncylipp
Reviews.Content: Each room had a unique design with interesting combinations of wallpaper, contemporary lighting and unique furniture. The common areas were beautifully designed with polka dot carpet in the stairwells, full wall murals in the dining room and elevator and colourful and well thought out accessories. The bathroom was very modern with large towels and heated towel rack. There was only a bath with a hand-held shower, which could not be suspended above head height which made showers and particularly washing hair very difficult. There also wasn't a shower screen so the entire bathroom/toilet/sink got saturated. Not sure if this was the same in every room (we had the cheapest room). The staff always had a smile, were friendly and gave good advice. Although there was wi-fi internet, you had to log into it every time you used it and it was quite painfully slow. The location was excellent. The Marais is probably one of the coolest suburbs in Paris, being home to both the Jewish and gay communities. We could explore the more touristy streets with shopping, cafes and bakeries or chill just a few streets away with the locals. We were within walking distance of many main tourist attractions and restaurants but for anything further afield there was a train station two blocks away. The breakfast the hotel offered was lovely. There was fruit salad, cereal, orange juice, coffee, hot chocolate, croissants, breads, jams and yogurt, all served in a really cute dining room. Unfortunately we didn't realise breakfast wasn't included and got a bit of a surprise when we paid for the room and had additional 15 euro daily charges. Not the end of the world. It was tasty! We would definitely recommend Hotel du Petit Moulin.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, perfect location, beautiful interior - choose this!”
Reviews.Author: seri_over
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel du petit moulin in june 2011. We had a superior room, but was toghether with to friends who stayed in comfort rooms and all were equally nice. The staff was very accomorating and helping us with all questions we might have. The location is superb. Especially if you like the Marais district, with all the little boutiques and restaurants! I was a bit curious about the breakfast before we got there, because I feared a simple continental breakfast. I was relieved, even though the breakfast is continental, there is fruit salad, yoghurt, sweet and plain bread, cheese, jams and whatever coffee you'd like. I especially enjoyed the fact that the hotel was small! It made us feel like a valued guest.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Marais”
Reviews.Author: raisingkaine
Reviews.Content: Olivier = 5 stars [hotel staff is outstanding]. The hotel I'd give 3 1/2. I really wanted to like this hotel given the great reviews. The bed was fairly comfortable. The star and a half deduction can be mostly attributed to the tired and CB2'ish decor - yes, funky but closer inspection is by no means 5 stars. The bathroom itself is roomy [in the executive] but the tub only had a handheld shower head meaning you have to crouch and/or 'take a bath' shower. The Very slow drain = bath time. Warming towel rack adds a nice touch. Location is ideal in the Marais and the wireless did not work well in our room on our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Marais Location”
Reviews.Author: LaurelM43
Reviews.Content: Can't recommend this hotel highly enough. Super location, great staff (most speak english, if you must) fabulous decor, etc, etc. My only caveat would be, if you're the strictly-5 star, Penninsula Hotel type, this might not be your spot - although it is luxurious in its own special way, the elevator is small and creaky, the beds weren't exactly sumptuous, the maids sometimes leave vacuum cords strewn across the hall and the aforementioned decor may be a bit "loud" for the boring old fuddy-duddy sorts. Like I said - the plus side: the Marais at your feet- you're in Paris for crying out loud, why the hell would you be spending free time in your hotel!?

Reviews.Title: “wonderful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: artist062
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time in Paris..... and loved the hotel du petit moulin. It was beautifully decorated, very clean and the staff was very helpful. The bathroom was a very nice size as well with all of the important things supplied .... magnifying mirror, robe, etc. Although there is not a full restaurant, breakfast was available in a cute litte bar room. It was a delight and I hope to visit again one day. Sincerely, Gwenn

Reviews.Title: “great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: tommy071
Reviews.Content: This historic building hides a very unique boutique hotel that offers comfort, funcionnality and character. The staff was the best I have ever experienced and spoke fluent English. They offered us a nice Lacroix keyring when they knew it's our honeymoon. We particularly loved the central location and free wifi. We had also drinks in the stylish bar which was very nice too. A really great place to stay in Paris and away from the tourists traps.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat disappointing”
Reviews.Author: WYWF
Reviews.Content: After reading great reviews about this hotel on Trip Advisor and various other publications we had high expectations for Petit Moulin. Perhaps we got a dud room (402), being on the top (4th) floor it had very low ceilings (under the Mansard) and we had to carry our luggage up a flight of stairs as the elevator only services up to the third floor. We were surprised that the room was looking a little rundown. The shag pile rug was matted and dirty and there was water damage and broken fittings in the ensuite bathroom. However the room we stayed in was tastefully decorated, though not one of the more extravagantly designed rooms. The breakfast was OK and while nothing to rave about, it was convenient for the week we stayed there. The location is a big plus, being in the Marais district (3rd arrondissement). Lots of nightlife, great shopping and excellent restaurants a stones throw fro the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, charming, small and interesting”
Reviews.Author: John-Six
Reviews.Content: This hotel was designed by Christian Lacroix, the quirky French fashion designer and each room is different. It is located in the amazing shopping district of Le Marais. From the outside is does not look like much, but inside it is stylish and has some of the features of the old mill it once was. We enjoyed its French style, its staff, its unique rooms, and its proximity to absolutely amazing shops.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MikeandAshley529
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent, my husband and I wanted to stay in a boutique hotel when we visited Paris, and The Hotel du Petit Moulin was a great choice! The location was awesome, you could walk to many landmarks, and the neighborhood is filled with cafes, art shops/galleries, and cool shopping; as well as good street photo-ops. The staff was great to us, we had great conversation with them and they even helped us book our tickets to Versaille. The rooms are cool, but as Christian Lacroix designed the hotel, the style will not suit all guests. If almost wacky designs are not your thing, maybe don't book a room here. It was a fun experience though, and breakfast was plesant too!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Boutique Extravaganza”
Reviews.Author: ycknows
Reviews.Content: There are so many great little things that I'd love to write about this hotel. I hope I haven't forgot anything. First off, the location is brilliant, in a little side street, on the corner. What used to be a little boulangerie. The inside of the hotel is a bit indescribable. It's truly beautiful in it's own eclectic way. The reception man who is usually on did the typical grumpy French man act, but was always hilarious and had a twinkle in his eye. He surely did love his vanilla cigarettes. It's tiny when you first walk in, but you go up the elevator which yes, smells like vanilla cigarettes, and you get to your room and they're all different. Wallpaper, beds, floors, bathrooms, carpets, chairs, everything is different! But they are amazing. Ours was split level with a little black carpeted staircase, down to the bed area. Only has a handful of rooms, so not that many people there in the first place. Breakfast was just right, only a couple of tables. Easy, simple meals that you order. I usually like bigger city hotels, but this was a charm. Usually just bought wine, cheese, olives, pates, fruit and that'd be our lunch and dinner, enjoying our time in the room in a truly romantic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Glamourous and chic but disappointing”
Reviews.Author: KDSpain
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel a month ago with my husband and another couple to celebrate a 40th birthday in Paris and we wanted to stay around le Marais and push the boat out. There's no disputing that the interior design of the Petit Moulin is impressive. The sweet reception converted from the very pretty boulangerie is fascinating and the individual rooms are both spotless and unique. However what we all found disappointing was the lack of atmosphere. There was a small bar, near to the reception but it was totally deserted, unstaffed and uninviting (I imagine had we required a drink the surly receptionist would have had to wander over from behind his desk and get it for us, but it didn't look like he wanted to at all.) This hotel is really quite expensive and promises room service, but on returning from a exhausting day shopping and sight-seeing, and feeling like a snack before going back out for dinner, the same surly receptionist said the kitchen was closed (this was 6.30pm on a saturday night) and the best he could offer was to tell us there was a packet of crisps in our mini-bar, or a supermarket around the corner. I'm sorry but on the rare occasions that I visit an expensive hotel I want to feel special, pampered and that nothing's too much trouble. This hotel felt like "..Here you go - one boutique hotel in an interesting area of Paris..... what you want some service too? Forget it!" Oh yeh, and waking up to sound of a cleaner hoovering in the next door bedroom early in the morning is not exactly perfect either.

Reviews.Title: “Made our trip: great location, staff & rooms”
Reviews.Author: andrewdevitt
Reviews.Content: The staff made us feel absolutely at home, the rooms were large, quite and beautifully decorated and the location is perfect for relaxing, shopping or as a base to launch an assault on the sites. All this combined to make us feel like we were experiencing Paris as locals, rather than being caught up in the tourist rush of a Parisian summer. We would absolutely return as that feeling of being 'at home' makes for such a different holiday experience.

Reviews.Title: “hip location in arty location”
Reviews.Author: cocopopsdog
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Paris and spent 5 nights in this hotel.The hotel was in a great local area bursting with boutique shopping and galleries.I love to shop and found this area great for more individual pieces rather than your chain stores.The hotel is quirky and everything the pictures show it to be.I travelled with my 15 year old daughter and it showed a slower more bohemian side of paris.We stayed in three different areas and each offered different things.If you like more unique accomodation and great shops this is for you.The metro is at the corner so you can be in the action if you choose very quickly,it was lovely returning at the end of the day for some quiet time.would deffinately reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “in the northern Marais:a heaven of chic”
Reviews.Author: RodolfoLara
Reviews.Content: we go to paris at least 4 times a year for long weekends. and we always stay at le p'tit moulin. we never tire of trying new rooms (every room has its own decor). a charming french breakfast every morning is the perfect way to start the day before proceeding to rue charlot and its boutiques... charming service à l'ancienne... philippe at the lobby will greet you with a bonjour that really means it. an authentic piece of paris

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Inhabit
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of a kind. Each room is unique - which to me is a luxury. The staff was wonderful, the room was kept very tidy. Our air conditioning worked well and the bedding was clean and crisp. Although small, the room was smarty organized and lovely with big windows in both the room and bathroom. This is not a room to hang out in, but I didn't go to Paris to sit in a hotel room. The location is off the beaten path - but surrounded with some of the hippest places in town. You won't know it unless your hip enough to recognize them. This hotel is not for everyone, but for those looking to escape the obvious, tourist appeal and enter the creative and interesting side of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: Kadek70
Reviews.Content: Exceptional service, advice and support , even above expectations. The very cozy room and delicious breakfast made for a perfect stay. I recommend also the trendy location . I'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not worth the hype”
Reviews.Author: ArtProperty
Reviews.Content: Look if you are the kind of person that gets excited because you are in a hotel designed or frequented by someone famous then yes this place is worth a stay. If not you can get much better in Paris. There is nothing extraordinary about the decor and I say that as someone whose business it is to evaluate decor. The rooms are not very large or well thought out in terms of usage or amenities and the place was not as clean as it should have been . Service was minimal and after two nights I thought it was just not worth a second visit. But enjoy for those of you who do like this sort of thing.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: BrendaHKT
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from our trip to Paris and the hotel du Petit Moulin was definitely one of the best parts of it. We had booked a Supérieure room and were given #102. The receptionist told us it has recently been redesigned by Christian Lacroix. You bet we were rather excited. And it was really worth the excitement as the room was incredible!!!! A mix of different patterns that you would never imagine they could match together, but they did. Hey, we’re speaking of a “haute couture” hotel!!! The bed was very comfy and the bathroom spotlessly clean. The staff were all very friendly, courteous, smiling and helpful and nothing was too much trouble for them. They gave us very good recommendations for restaurants or nice places to visit in the hotel neighborhood. Lots of very hype fashion stores and art galleries around. The hotel location is fantastic, right in the center of the city. You’re walking distance to a lot of places such as Notre Dame, the Louvre etc which is a big plus since the traffic in Paris is rather hectic. The metro is fast and convenient though and the nearest station about 5 minutes walking. This hotel has now become our home away from home, and we will definitely stay here the next time we’ll fly to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, dark hotel”
Reviews.Author: Abs64
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent position to explore Paris and is ideally situated for the evening bars and restaurants in the Marais area. First impressions are that the hotel is quirky and uniquely decorated, however after a few days it becomes dark and dingy. We stayed in the best room in the hotel on the top floor in the attic. In the rain it is very noisy. The bathroom was small and very poorly lit. The shower attachment on the bath has a rail to use as a shower, but is poorly designed and only people under 4ft could use it as a shower. The room itself had no mirror. The hotel is small and I would imagine that no room would escape the noise of the elavator. On the plus side, the bed was very comfortable and the hotel provided free secure underground car parking a few yards away. We did not take breakfast in the hotel as there are many cafes within 5 minutes walk. The bar is serviced by the receptionist so it's not the type of hotel that you would do anything but sleep in, but due to its great location, what else would you need.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous....”
Reviews.Author: JCSChine
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the HOTEL du PETIT MOULIN in le Marais and i must say that i have been deliciously surprised by the atmosphere of this place and the capabality of the personal, especially the general manager, always availble for his customers. in this small and beautiful hotel the customer is really helped during his stay : advices for restaurants with good quality and prices, finding a taxi when it's raining... the decoration of my room was really surprising and nothing to do with all these chains hote that I usually visit. at last the location is exceptionnal, in the heart of Paris thank you again to the management of LE PETIT MOULIN

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in hippest part of paris”
Reviews.Author: losangelesgirl20
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Hotel du Petit Moulin and had a great time. First of all, we arrived in paris at 7am, after taking the red eye from NY. The consierge let us into our room 5 hours early so we could nap for the first part of the morning, which was a total life-saver. The hotel is in La Marais, which is a great little neighborhood with many designer boutiques, great coffee shops and not too touristy. (I would say it has the feel of Williamsburg in Brooklyn and Hayes Valley in SF). The price of the rooms are $$, but if you're looking for a romantic place to stay in Paris, and you want to see a non-touristy side of Paris, I would really recommend this hotel and neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Super Cute Hide Away”
Reviews.Author: Crash89
Reviews.Content: This hidden little hotel is something I will remember the rest of my life. First off I'm not sure if taxi drivers know where Rue du Poitou is and unless they have their maps or GPS in order you may be in for a long winding exploration of the areas narrow and very Parisian streets. I would recommend taking the Metro from the St. Sebastien-Froisart station and walking straight down rue du pt. aux Choux which will get you to the hotel without making a turn in just a few short blocks. The Hotel suggests using the Filles du Calvaire stop but we didn't do this. As you can expect this hotel is small but terribly cute. Our room was on the fourth floor, the top floor but the elevators only got to the third so we needed to take a steep narrow staircase to our room; thankfully a bellman was available to handle the bags! The room it's self was rather cozy with an angled ceiling wall to add some drama to the look. Included in the room is a safe, television, closet, bathroom without a shower but a modern bath and some decorative lighting. There was no clock so we relied on wake up calls (cute music plays) in the morning. I thought breakfast was included with the room but for the life of me I don't know why. Anyway the continental breakfast served in their small restaurant was a great was to start the day. The staff was very friendly and helpful with local suggestions. They do speak English if that's a need. The area the hotel is located in is surprisingly full of boutiques, little restaurants and an American Apparel just a few steps around the corner (strange but true). There's a pretty little park with a duck pond not too far off as well. If you can get your bearings right Notre Dame is also accessible by foot but I took a couple wrong turns and added too much distance to the jaunt. There is something very French about the hotel and the area that made the experience wonderful and I would have no problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best staff”
Reviews.Author: KohSamuiTipa
Reviews.Content: I was there during one week, the location, the hotel and the room are very nice. The staff at the front desk are very smilling, polite, and they gave me very good recommandations for place to eat, where to go and what to do during all my stay. I never see any other staff like them ..... Is there a special school for that ? I don't think so .... Sure they like what they do and they do it with pleasure ..... The room is very clean, enough space for a Parisian hotel. If one day I need to go back in Paris I'll be back to this hotel and nowhere else......

Reviews.Title: “One of the beauties of wonderful Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Elisabetta1011
Reviews.Content: It was the 2nd time we went to the "Hotel du Petit Moulin" and it had confirmed the excellent impression we had two years ago. The personnel was very friendly and the room was extraordinary: big, comfortable, stilish, and unique... absolutely 1st class! Extremely easy to reach by the "metropolitain", the hotel is located in the Marais, very typical and central. We definitely will be going back to the Petit Moulin as is one of the best representations of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Gay Fab, and you don't have to be gay to appreciate that.”
Reviews.Author: TracyeHerrington
Reviews.Content: - decor is smashing....only the French have a touch like that. - room service - the "breakfast in bed" with baguettes and croissants, not to mention the French press coffee....pure delight. - Felipe and Lojo.....pulled a rabbit out of a hat with getting us a reservation at a Michelon 3 star restaurant with only a couple days notice. Not only that, they seemed to care about us - if we were enjoying Paris. Even joking with us when we didn't get out of the hotel room until 6pm one day. Felipe, in his best French-accented English, piped out "good morning, girls" with a sheepish smile and a twinkle in his eyes. I had been on a business trip for a week prior in the UK, and I had a ton of laundry. These guys had it sent out and back the same day. Each garment neatly packaged in clear plastic separate from the other. Man...the French do EVERYTHING right! They really are superior people. Sadly, I don't think hotels like this exist in the US. I'm glad the French have figured out that elevating the hotel experience, however short of a time that's spent in the room, is an important aspect of a vacation. Thank you for such a wonderful stay. We'll see you again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Location and nothing more”
Reviews.Author: ryzee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights at the end of our 3 week, 7 hotel, trip around France and this was definitely the worst. We splurged on certain legs of our trip around France and knew we were going a bit budget here but were really disappointed. We knew the rooms would be small and it was but we were okay with that. We were in a superior room and 2 people with two suitcases and a couple of handbags meant we were a bit cramped. The hotel requested that we hand our room key into the front desk when we left so that they would know we where not in the room and could attend to it, great!! When we returned from 5 hours of touring Paris (3:30pm) our room was still unmaid., ugh!! At 3:45pm the front desk called and said the maid could not make up the room as we were there and she went home at 4pm. We had to settle for a few towels handed through the door as our service for the day. On the positive side the room is ideally located in the beautiful Le Marais area of Paris. In my opinion the best neighborhood in Paris. This hotel is priced very reasonably for Paris but don't expect anything in the way of service.

Reviews.Title: “To be honest, I was a little disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: nobodysnobody
Reviews.Content: Earlier this year I stayed at the hotel Bellechasse next to the Musee D'Orsay. It's a wonderful hotel, designed by Christian Lacroix and oozing style and character. I was so taken with the Bellechasse, that when I discovered there was another Lacroix designed hotel in my favourite district of Le Marais I truly thought I'd discovered the hotel of my dreams. So maybe my expectations were a little high, but I have to say that in all honesty I was slightly disappointed with Le Petit Moulin. The hotel looks fantastic on the website, but although I chose a superior room, it was nothing particularly special. It was painted a mint green with one wall papered in a floral design. The bathroom was slightly whacky - a riot of patterned tiles, but really nothing too exciting. Compare this with the Bellechasse, where I had men in top hats on the ceiling, crinoline ladies on the walls, snakeskin tiles and a massive rolltop bath in the bedroom swathed in a big velvet curtain, and it was a big let down. I was also felt that for the price and the hype it was poorly appointed. Again, at the Bellechasse there was an ipod station and a DVD player, whereas the Petit Moulin provided no more than a TV. There was an overwhelming air of it all being a bit bog standard, and not at all helped by the unsmiling receptionist who made absolutely no effort to make us feel welcome on our arrival. Maybe if I hadn't stayed at the Bellechasse I wouldn't have felt so disappointed, but I couldn't help but feel that this was Lacroix on a much smaller budget. There was little here that you wouldn't find in any half decent hotel nowadays. The breakfast room was cold and uninviting, whereas every square inch of the Bellechasse's breakfast room was a feast for the eyes. On the plus side the Petit Moulin is in a funky area, great for young people in particular, and apart from the sourfaced receptionist on day one, all the other staff were perfectly friendly. It was very clean and quiet but I'm not sure that I'd stay there again. Only stay here if you really want to stay in Le Marais. If that's not a priority, and you're looking for somewhere completely OTT in terms of style and character, then stay at the Bellechasse instead.

Reviews.Title: “Opulent but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: dlelondon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel du Petit Moulin for the first 2 nights of our honeymoon in Paris. We were looking for a little luxury and loved the look of the hotel from the website - stylish rooms and a great location. We were certainly not disappointed with our room (quite small but that's to be expected in Paris) but with a giant bath tub and beautiful wallpaper. Unfortunately though the gentleman on the front desk really didn't make us feel very welcome. After a 7 hour drive from the South of France (the day after our wedding) he could barely raise a 'congratulations' and when we asked for room service, he told us only sandwiches were available (not what you expect when you're paying £250 per night). We then asked if he could recommend an informal restaurant for a quick dinner nearby but this seemed too much to ask. To be fair the staff for the rest of the weekend were much friendlier but our first impression wasn't of great service. I would certainly recommend this hotel for it's location - fabulous shops, boutiques and cafes in the Marais district and for the opulent Christian Lacroix decor but probably wouldn't return as feel it is overpriced with hit and miss staff.

Reviews.Title: “stylish hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: LBToni
Reviews.Content: we just spent 3 nights at du Petit Moulin and had a great time. The hotel is wildly stylish yet comfortable, the location is great and the staff were very nice. The hotel rate did not include breakfast but a quick pastry stop started off our days. There was some street noise on weekends but being a light sleeper I travel with earplugs. Overall a very good experience at Hotel du Petit Moulin.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tom-23-London
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel, great location and very friendly staff. We stayed in early January 2009 and had such a great time. we got room 202 which my girlfriend wanted as it features on a lot of the websites and promotional material (see pic on http://www.paris-hotel-petitmoulin.com/petit-moulin-hotel-english/the-rooms-01.html for what room 202 looks like) The staff were very friendly at all times, always happy to serve us a drink in the bar when we came back late. the room was brilliant. Big room with great interesting furnishings, a shag-piled carpet, flat screen TV and a bathroom with a big bath Had a great 3 nights here. However if you want conventional style and muted tones don't go here. If you're adventurous it's a place you won't forget

Reviews.Title: “Good location, quaint but just nice.”
Reviews.Author: pelun
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night superior room 16 Dec 2008. Location is very good in the Marais. Hotel is small and quaint. The décor is obviously special. The lobby and bar is nice. But that is my general impression of the hotel: Nice. For being a relatively newly renovated hotel I must say the standard/quality pretty low and rundown, already. The superior room was rather average although good size. Not sure this was a Lacroix designed room, or maybe he had a bad day with this one. Bathroom with bathtub but no shower curtain so floor became all wet. Cheap bathroom products. Room service at night ridiculously expensive. Furthermore do not think reception staff as friendly and courteous as other reviews stating. Reception called 2 minutes after twelve rudely asking if we intended to stay one more night since we had not yet checked out. Told them we were running a little late but would be down in 20 minutes. Exactly 20 minutes after twelve they called again. It was a Wednesday and hotel was far from fully booked, so this behaviour was annoying. Really like design hotels but Petit Moulin is not quite my taste for what they charge.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: RJJAtlanta
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked through the door we knew we were about to experience something special. The room was ready early as we requested and we were jokingly "scolded" for being a little later than anticipated. Starting off with a good laugh is a good thing. The entire staff was helpful and so friendly. The room (301) was spacious, comfortable and meticulously clean. The location is perfect -- on a residential street, steps away from the hustle and bustle of The Marais and convenient to the Metro. Several affordable cafes are nearby. Be sure and take a map and a business card from the hotel the first time you leave. We were lost in a matter of minutes and had to rely on the kindness of local shopkeepers to help us find our way back. We will definitely be staying here again -- the sooner the better!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Feeber
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the start of an 8 week trip to France and Italy. There were 3 of us - including a 9 year old child. We had a deluxe suite which was room 402. It was spacious and the extra bed was a fold away but more than fine. The lift only went to level 3 (we were on level 4) so we had to go the rest of the way up the stairs. No big deal and there was always someone on hand for the bags. Check in was easy - we had arrived straight from Oz and they did their best to get our room as quickly as they could. The room was big with a comfortable bed and was well maintained and serviced. Staff at the front desk were very helpful - some were friendlier than others but all were good at dealing with queries. Breakfast was 15 euros and a lot of food. It is arguable that you can go down the street and get what you need for say 7-8 euros, but it was convenient and you won't leave hungry. The three of us had three lumps of baguette, about 7 croissants/pains au chocolat etc, bowl of fruit salad each, cereal, cheese, yoghurt and coffee/tea/hot chocolate. No hot food if that matters. You could easily load up at brekkie then skip lunch and aim for dinner if you wanted to save some money. The location is in the Marais, which is very cool. You do get a better sense of the "real" Paris as you are not bombarded with tourist traps like in other areas. There are loads of restaurants nearby (within say 10 minutes walk) and also close to shops etc. The nearest metro is about 5 minutes walk. The only disappointing thing about this hotel is its room service. Now you might ask why we bothered with room service given the location but we were tired after the trip and didn't feel like going out! Anyway, it starts at 8pm and the menu has two parts to it. For one, you need to order at least 50 euros worth of food for them to deliver it but they don't combine with the part of the menu. I think they organise it via a couple of local resturants. We ordered some food including a sushi plate for two people for 28 euros. We got about 10 pieces of sushi! It was ridiculous! Best not to bother with the room service and make the effort and go out. This is a small groovy hotel (designed by Christian Lacroix) with a very boutique feel. The staff make the effort to remember your name and room number and it's so much more personal than a larger hotel. The location is convenient and we really enjoyed our stay. We'd definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely”
Reviews.Author: skg0871
Reviews.Content: We booked after seeing a review of this boutique hotel in the Times. Every room (it is small so only 15) is individually decorated by Christian Lacroix. Perfectly situated near boutiques and lovely traditional cafes, bars, restaurants. Very friendly staff, very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great service at this excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paulgoo
Reviews.Content: We only spent one night in this night hotel but we had a fantastic time, Laurent the concierge was excellent and probably the most helpful guy you will ever come across. I asked him about the local galleries on arrival, an hour later he had composed a full list together just for us, he even checked each one so we would know which was open, a lot of art galleries are closed in august for summer holidays. Later in the evening he organised a cabaret night for us at our request, phoning around and go us a great discount too. Its a great boutique hotel in a great location, the room we stayed in had high celings with exposed beams, with lovely french windows, some great period details and lovely wallpapers, the whole hotel was spotlessly clean.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, romantic hotel”
Reviews.Author: christiansunderland
Reviews.Content: Spent one night with my wife at this wonderful, charming hotel in Le Marais. It's expensive, but well worth it for a treat. The building has bundles of character and the design has a great, luxury boutique feel. The bathroom was beautiful and the free standing bath was big enough to swim in! Breakfast was served by really friendly, helpful staff and was delicious. The location is great, and there's a really ace looking restaurant opposite, but unfortunately it was closed when we returned to try it! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Very cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: eyedubya
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to spend a 1 night layover (business trip) in Paris, and opted for Hotel du Petit Moulin sight unseen (except for the cool website). I had an Executive Room, which was more than enough for my needs. The bathroom was very big by Paris standards. Keep in mind if you aren't familiar with Paris hotels, don't expect a stand up shower. Very cool decor in the room, comfortable bed, etc. I wish I could have stayed longer, and would definitely stay there again. The lobby lounge was nice for a glass of champagne. I did not stick around for breakfast -- had a flight to catch. The immediate 1 block around the hotel is quiet, but the overall neighborhood is a great one, much more authentic and local than staying in a hotel near C-E.

Reviews.Title: “Let's face it, Parisien hotels are expensive.........”
Reviews.Author: Stinkaroo
Reviews.Content: Let's face it, Parisien hotels are expensive, especially towards the summer high season. I used to be one who prided myself in finding the value option in town, but I just gave up this time. One goes to Paris to enjoy oneself and to be hedonistic, and the hotel is an integral part of this experience. Location The Petit Moulin is in the Marais, near to Republique or Oberkampf stations (for those coming from Gare du Nord). My companion had spent some time in Paris earlier and her favourite area was St. Germain des Pres, but after this trip our favourite is firmly the Marais. Yes it can get unruly and yobbish at night but there are so many lively, young bars in the area as well as trendy clothes shops down Rue Vieille du Temple. Petit Moulin is a 5 minute walk from this world but still away from the craziness at the same time. Room The building is quirky and really quite cool. The reception is warm and personal and we were shown our "superior" room within 5 minutes of arriving. Our room, 203, is in the corner on the second floor with two large windows facing the street. It had a blue theme with blue-tiled bathroom, which was a bit too dark at first but really grew on us. The quirkiness extends to the room - light switches that are totally unpredictable, a strange angular shape to the room. However, we had a most restful night's sleep with excellent sound insulation and good shower to wake us up to the beautiful sight of narrow Parisien streets. The lauded Christian Lacroix design is quite distinctive. The furnishings in the room were very well maintained and everything is cleaned perfectly. Given the obvious cost of maintaining the unique items in the room, everything looks impressively clean and new. Only complaint is of a leaky shower door seal that dripped water onto the bathroom floor. Service Quite impeccable. Sure there are not dozens of staff fussing around you, just one very helpful concierge-cum-receptionist who was happy to look up opening times and addresses for us on the internet. Overall This is not a full-service hotel. You're paying good money to stay in a really fun area in a fun place. Pay 100-150 instead and you might end up with a disappointing, grubby hotel on a noisy street (what happened to us last time) or something further out. I would stay here again, though maybe in the 290 euro room instead (which we stole a peek into), which was brighter and had a nice freestanding bath.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely delightful”
Reviews.Author: QuarterQ
Reviews.Content: Went to the Hotel du Petit Moulin while in Paris for the first time for our anniversary. We usually skip the chain hotels and try to find boutique hotels whenever we travel, and this hotel was perfectly Paris. The best thing about the hotel by far is its location. In the 3rd arrondissement, a very nice walk to almost everywhere. We didn't have to use the metro or taxi at all, walked everywhere (Louvre, Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame .. etc). The cafes and bars around the area make it a very pleasant walk or just a relaxing time out. The staff was superb too, they were very helpful in giving directions, suggestion, making reservations, and even changing our room when we first arrived. They gave a decent room at first, but very plain, which defied the whole purpose of going to designer hotel. We asked for something more colorful and unique, and they happily moved us to room 301, which was very interesting (the pictures of the room are found in the traveler photos section). Very clean rooms, friendly staff, excellent location, the only drawback is the size of the room, which is pretty small but manageable. Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay anywhere else in Paris!!!”
Reviews.Author: JJandJoliesMom
Reviews.Content: My husband Justin and I, along with members of our wedding party, had the sincere pleasure of staying in the Hotel du Petit Moulin from April 24th through the 27th for our wedding in Paris. Prior to our arrival, the staff was infinitely patient and eagerly accomodating with the many changes we had to make to the reservations for our group. From the first moment of our arrival to our sad departure, we enjoyed truly world class service from the entire staff. In addition to offering us the warmest of welcomes as well as being gracious, polite, and knowledgeable, the hotel staff was made generous and expeditious efforts to meet our every need during our stay. From something as small as negotiating last minute reservations for our large party at top Parisian restaurants, to finding a reputable jeweler at the last minute to size my ring the day before the wedding, the Hotel du Petit Moulin fulfilled our every need and desire. I must offer an extra special thanks to Phillipe, who MIRACULOUSLY found a shop to supply replacement wedding jewelry for me (I realized at the last moment that I'd forgotten mine in the US!) literally a half an hour before our wedding was scheduled to begin. The hotel staff even exceeded our requests and expectations with Herculean efforts such as offering to learn how to handtie a bowtie for my husband and cleaning our room after hours the night of the wedding and adorning the room with rose petals to make our first evening as husband and wife that much more special. In addition to the amazing service, the hotel is GORGEOUS. Its perfectly quaint and artfully decorated. Because we had so many guests staying in the hotel with us, we had the opportunity to view several of the rooms and I can assure you that each one is a design adventure that you will not soon forget. I really cannot say enough about how wonderful our stay was. We will NEVER stay any place else in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THE CHICKEN COOP!”
Reviews.Author: SEANATL
Reviews.Content: Hi! My partner Sean and I...a couple of gay guys from Atlanta....stayed here for three days. Being Americans and extreemly poor with the US Dollar so low...we had to settle for the "Confort" level versus the better rooms on the lower levels. We stayed in room 401, which I affectionately call the Chicken Coop because of all bird cooing we heard out our window. I think the birds were pigeons not chickens though!. The room was nice...but not over the top design wise as we had hoped. It was also very very noisy on Friday and Saturday nights as it is on the top floor facing the street. We are big partiers and stayed out late and had a good bit to drink...but were still a bit bothered by the street noise which seemed to go on until day break on both nights. If you are sensitive to noise and don't have much tolerance for loud drunks....maybe try for a room on the other side of the building. The staff were very very nice and very very helpful. They don't recomend the restauraunt next door, Relais Confort, but we found it to be very good and resonably priced. Also...we were under the impression that their was a bit of a bar crowd at the hotel...but there was nothing going on while we were there. The bar in reality is just a breakfast area where they serve drinks at night. We had an "aperos" there one night but no one else every joined us. The location is great and not too far from the exciting areas of Le Marais or the Metro stops. We would stay here again but would upgrade to the better rooms. We loved the wallpaper store next door as well, you must check it out!

Reviews.Title: “love love love it!”
Reviews.Author: sweetmags
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the best location in Paris- La Marais. To be there on a weekend is to really see Paris. The hotel is small and not entirely user friendly, but it more than makes up for this with beauty, style and location. Designed by Christian LaCroix, each room is uniquely appointed like a piece of art. We were so excited to explore all of the facets of our room--perfect eye candy. Now some of the beauty is not so functional--there was terrible lighting [for you ladies this means that make up application is a pain in the butt] and the only lighting in the bathroom came from an overhead fixture. Also, while there was a big lovely bath tub, there was no shower or shower glass so using the hand held nozzle meant flooding the bathroom. There was also very little space for luggage and/or clothes and even less space for bathroom items, etc. Like virtually every other hotel in Paris, space is limited. Breakfast is not included, but I would suggest heading over to Cafe Charlot and sitting down for brunch with all of the trendy Parisians in the neighborhood--it is not to be missed. Overall, despite its inefficiencies, I still loved this hotel and would absolutely stay there again. Do not underestimate its location--this is the ONLY place I will ever stay in Paris from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: richardholt
Reviews.Content: We are not normally the type to enjoy boutique / ultra stylish hotels, however I do recommend here for a number of reasons. Our room - an executive room which was large with good bathroom and very cosy bed; and particularly the staff - friendly, good advice and particularly and excellent knowledge of restaurants. For someone whom dislikes the trend of large chain hotels with no atmosphere this is the place to come. The local area is also very interesting with plenty of boutiques and cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic all around!”
Reviews.Author: Wandering_Misfit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Petit Moulin Dec. 26, 07 to Jan. 2, 07. In one of the suites in the attic (the 4th floor). This was a truly wonderful hotel, and we loved our stay. It is charming and exciting. The room was quite large and the bed comfortable. The decor was 100% Christian LaCroix, totally colorful and in-your-face but very tasteful. The location in the Marais was great -- basically between Republique and Centre Pompidou. The service was TRULY phenomenal. Every person at the concierge desk was 100% attentive to our every request. They were extremely professional and very pleasant. If I had to lodge complaints, I would only have two. First, the elevator didn't go all the way to the top (4th) floor. It stopped on the 3rd floor, and we had to climb the very narrow staircase to get to the room. (And with all the wonderful wine France has to offer, that could provide for a dangerous late-night situation.) On the other hand, that was part of the charm. Second, the suite didn't have a stand-up shower. It had a European-style tub with hand shower. And there was no shower-curtain or shower-door, so it made for a rather challenging bathing experience (if you're an American used to stand-up showers). All the rooms, I think, are different. So, some may have stand-up showers. Altogether, we thought it was a pretty good value (for Paris) and a wonderful value.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden in The Marais is this jewel.”
Reviews.Author: twofourseven
Reviews.Content: Discovered where this hotel is listed after we visited it for an escape to Paris. It is a jem of a hotel. Quiet, clean and cool. And the side streets around here are places where you want to get lost. There are also plenty of cool restaurants around and the odd market for your weekend shopping if you've travelled from London and want some provisions for back home. Colourful, comfortable and romantic. You cannot go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously stylish only need apply........................!”
Reviews.Author: Sunchaser56
Reviews.Content: If you want to splash out a bit and enjoy a really unique small boutique experience then this is the place for you. Great location just 10 mins from the eurostar and walking distance of the river and Sacre Coeur. Take the recommendations of where to eat from reception, they know who's hot (and most importantly who's not). Stayed for 3 nights and loved it....rooms not huge but SO cool!

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully decorated small hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: D&BCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in Hotel du Petit Moulin very much. The hotel is small with seventeen rooms, all differently appointed (the staff gave us a tour of a few rooms as we waited for our taxi). The hotel’s interiors were designed my noted clothing designer Christian Lacroix. Though generally small, all the rooms we saw were stylish to the point where you could see coming back 16 additional times just to stay in them all. This is your place if you value uniquely styled rooms over large amounts of space. The location is excellent and convenient. The staff was attentive, reliable, and efficient, with a little big city edge. Hotel du Petit Moulin is a unique place to stay in a beautiful city. We would definitely consider coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Witty, stylish and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: UkCarver
Reviews.Content: Although expensive (and way more than we'd normally pay), this is everything I'd want from a Paris hotel. The Petit Moulin manages to combine being super-stylish, witty and incredibly good fun with being comfortable (great beds, lovely duvet, fantastic bathroom, good AC). I worried that all this style might be intimidating but the staff are as friendly and fun as the rooms. And the location - tucked away on a quiet street in the Marais - was perfect. Worth the splurge.

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: madhack
Reviews.Content: I would have to agree with the earlier review about the Executive Suite. We had a big bathroom with a bathtub, but no shower and no place to put soap etc. while bathing so we were forced into a sitcom mode of trying to reach for the soap, wash hair, reach for the soap. The staff too is a problem--came up quickly with an iron and ironing board and then instead of taking it back, just stashed it in clear sight. Also, the whole charges around WIFI are ridiculous, but this is a a problem in many a Paris hotel. Get with it. We're already paying loads and don't need to pay extra--a lot extra--for WIFI that is essentially free to the hotel. Finally, I've had it with with high priced hotels that also charge 15 E for a breakfast that can be had down the street for 5 E. Okay, I'm done complaining, but I think there ought to be a campaign against WIFI charges and breakfast charges for hotels that are charging more than $300 a room.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic Paris for a STEAL”
Reviews.Author: blazerlady
Reviews.Content: Two seperate, unrelated friends suggested the Hotel du Petit Moulin with glowing reviews. Considering there's hundreds (if not over a thousand hotels in Paris) I found that coincidence to be an absolute sell on this hotel. Not being used to the small size of Parisian Hotel Rooms, at first I was disappointed in our room...b/c it was small and we had just come from Prague where our hotel was probably 3 times the size for the same price. Knowing that was our first reaction now, Im ashamed b/c the longer I thought about it and realized how little we were paying, what great service we were getting and how expensive this city is when it comes to hotel rooms, I realized we got this room for an absolute steal! We chose the Hotel du Petit Moulin for our honeymoon stay b/c we wanted to experience Paris in a more romantic and authentic way than the big American/chain hotels could offer, and we got it. The neighborhood the hotel is in is very quiet but only a few blocks from busier avenues (Beaumarchais in one direction, and Rue De Rivoli) in the other. The area is ultra-chic , with hip boutiques lining the streets belonging to up and coming designers. The Place de Vosges, the old Jewish Quarter and the Picasso Museum are all within a few blocks. The Louvre and the Notre Dame were roughly a 30-45 minute walk from here. As for the hotel itself, it is quite small (only about 14 rooms or so) so we received special attention from the various concierges and from the very small but friendly staff. The hotel is built into what was once a bakery. There are charming authentic touches (old french windows and ancient wooden ceiling beams, not to mention the original 'boulangerie' sign above the entryway) , coupled with the high interior design of Christian De LaCroix. Each room is unique. Even if the design in some rooms is not to your taste (and some are quite 'out there'), you can't not appreciate their creativity. The beds were so comfortable (with big down comforters), that siestas were calling to us each day we were there. For roughly $300 US dollars (250 euros) for a superior room, I really dont think you can beat this deal for this caliber of hotel /service (regardless of its small size). My only complaint- the hotel offers breakfast for 15 euros a person which seemed overpriced (considering it consisted of croissants, tea/coffee, fruit salad) but in Paris, what else is new. Also, just a warning- apparently only one room in the hotel has a stand up shower...the rest have tubs. This may be a "Parisian thing" but for all of you Americans used to showers... dont expect to find one in your room at this hotel. My husband had a hard time squeezing into the bath for the first time in years, but eventually he grew to love it.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: lawyer2206981
Reviews.Content: My wife and me stayed there in June, 2007 for our summer holidays. Its an excellent hotel in the very center of Paris (3rd arrondissement). Quiet neighbourhood, designed rooms, superb staff, free private parking 50 meters away. Better than lot of 5 star hotels weve stayed. Strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Send the staff to charm school”
Reviews.Author: 2herringc
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location and charming facade - shame about the charmless staff and overrated decor. We paid a higher rate for an executive room hoping for something special - but our 'executive' room was rather ordinary and certainly nothing like the whizzy pictures on the website which motivated us to stay here. If Christian Lacroix designed our room then he's lost his va va voom. The day receptionist was surly, sarcastic and superior - and our welcome to the hotel was pretty cold, despite our valiant attempts to speak French to the staff. If you like warm, honest service don't book this hotel. I'd definitely stay in the Marais again, best location in Paris, but not this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: jlars
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful way to start our honeymoon. Both rooms we stayed in were beautifully decorated and unique. The most friendly and charming staff. They made us feel welcome from the minute we arrived, always looking after us so well and accomodating our every desire. We have had a fantastic time and very romantic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller040
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel in March after a friend recommended it, and we had the best experince. Very cute hotel in a perfect location! Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “petit treasure”
Reviews.Author: mary∧y
Reviews.Content: mary & andy. sydney. australia my boyfriend and i stayed in this hotel in paris for 4 days. We had such a terrific time. our room was beautiful and spotless clean. High ceilings with exposed beams, lovely dark timber floors, luscious sheer curtains and pristine white linen. We stayed on the first floor and it was really quiet. The staff were so great, and helpful. I got sick my second night there and they were very efficient and accomodating of our requests for such a small hotel with little staff. Marais is a great area for people wanting to stay away from the touristy things. i recommend it to young couples who want something interesting and very parisian.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: AudreyBB
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely 2 weeks at Hotel Petit du Moulin. Yes, 2 weeks – we stayed in the one hotel. With the Australian dollar conversion rates, it was a bit steep – but compared to other hotels in Paris, it was reasonable value. We had a wonderful time. The trip was for our honeymoon and we wanted something memorable. This was certainly the place. We really enjoyed the breakfasts. After the first breakfast, we thought we could find something cheaper elsewhere than 15 euro each – but the very next day we were back and had breakfast there everyday. I really miss the breakfasts. If you are looking for a cooked breakfast, look elsewhere – this is pure Parisian heaven. Freshly squeeze OJ, bread, cheese, fruit salad, yoghurt, croissants, chocolate pain and tea. And all served on delightful Villeroy and Boch china. Just superb. And the staff were so friendly. Every morning we’d try out a little more of our French on them! The staff in general were very helpful. We read other reviews complaining about the attitude– but can’t see what all the fuss was about. They were polite, helpful and prompt. What else could you want? If you want people to fall all over you…maybe you need to go to a big US-style hotel. We only knew phrase-book French, which we always tried first in conversations and then most people would then continue on in English. It’s rude to think you can just start speaking in English and expect everyone to follow suit. The front desk staff were particularly helpful when trying to book restaurants for us. After reading previous reviews, we specifically requested the one room with a shower. We thought that 2 weeks grappling with a hand held shower over a bath might be a pain. But of course, I was yearning for a bath every now and then. Plus our European friends told us that hand-held showers are very Parisian. So I really don’ think it would’ve been a big deal to have been in one of the other rooms. The design of the hotel was just magical. I was concerned from the photos on the website that it may be too over the top for a 2 week stay and that it could almost be ‘headache-inducing’. But the design was magical. Yes, it was colourful and vibrant but also warn and soothing. Amazing. I guess that is what good design is all about. Our room, I think was relatively sedate, compared to some of the photos of the other rooms. We had the ‘blue room’. The room was small as expected. If you had an open suitcase on the floor, you have to walk over it. But that was fine. We knew to expect that. The bed was comfy and the linen and towels just lovely and luxurious. Our room was true to the photos on the hotel’s website. The Marias area was great as well. Really enjoyed staying in the there. Some people have commented that it wasn’t in the heart of the Marais. Not sure what they meant by that. We thought it was a good location. Didn’t really have any problem with street noise, either. Maybe one night, but not worth commenting on. We are so happy that we stayed at Hotel du Petit Moulin for our honeymoon. It was such s memorable and distinctive experience. We would definitely recommend this hotel. If you want a distinctive individual Parisian experience, this is the place. If you want something that is more run of the mill and more ‘what you are used to’, perhaps look elsewhere.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel du Petit Moulin
HotelInfo.Address: 29 / 31 rue du Poitou, 75003 Paris, France
